speaker: SLOAN
line: All right, let’s shoot this, Marty.

speaker: MARTY
line: Hold it still. Hold it still, Sloan.

speaker: SLOAN
line: I’d like to see you hold it still. The sooner they pave over this swamp, the better.

speaker: MARTY
line: It’s not a swamp. You’re standing in a forest with indigenous plant and animal species you’re obviously too ignorant to appreciate. Mark it and give me another position.

speaker: SLOAN
line: All right, let’s shoot this next one real carefully, Marty, 'cause this is where they’re gonna put the Blockbuster.

speaker: MARTY
line: You’re a real moron, Sloan, you know that?

speaker: SLOAN
line: Tree hugger.

speaker: MARTY
line: You should be sad to see the demise of an ecosystem that’s lasted a thousand years. We all should be. Give me four feet to your left.

speaker: SLOAN
line: I can’t.

speaker: MARTY
line: What do you mean you can’t?

speaker: SLOAN
line: I mean I can’t because it’s stuck.

speaker: MARTY
line: Then unstick it.

speaker: SLOAN
line: This is weird.

speaker: MARTY
line: Sloan! Sloan!

speaker: FATHER
line: Louis, let Bo do the work.

speaker: LOUIS
line: How’s he know how to find a possum?

speaker: FATHER
line: Shhh. Animals sense things that we can’t. It’s how they survive.

speaker: LOUIS
line: Well, so is that how Bo knows how to hunt?

speaker: FATHER
line: Yeah. Our ancestors were hunters, too. But most of us have lost those instincts. That’s why we need a little help.

speaker: LOUIS
line: Dad, what’s that?

speaker: FATHER
line: Surveyor’s equipment. Someone left his stuff out here. Stay close, Louis.

speaker: LOUIS
line: What is it, Dad? Dad?

speaker: FATHER
line: Come here, Bo.

speaker: LOUIS
line: What.....

speaker: FATHER
line: Quiet. Listen to me. I want you to take Bo, and I want you to run straight home.

speaker: LOUIS
line: What’s the matter?

speaker: FATHER
line: I want you to run straight home and I don’t want you to stop for anything.

speaker: LOUIS
line: I just.....

speaker: FATHER
line: Louis? You understand? All right. Go.

speaker: LOUIS
line: Come on, Bo, come on. No, no. Come on, Bo. Come on. Come on! Come on!

speaker: MALE FBI AGENT (MIKE KINSLEY)
line: Last year was something of a personal revelation. We were doing an exercise called team builders? Where we were given two minutes to build a tower out of ordinary office furniture.

speaker: FEMALE AGENT (STONECYPHER)
line: When I stood on Mike’s shoulders and I put that electric pencil sharpener on top of the pile, we both knew, we could never have done it alone.

speaker: MULDER
line: Kill me now.

speaker: KINSLEY
line: You ever been to one of these team seminars, Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ummm.... I think I went to a constructive problem solving course when I first joined the Bureau.

speaker: STONECYPHER
line: Oh, did you play that game where, um, you can’t use any negative words?

speaker: KINSLEY
line: I couldn’t believe how hard it was not to use the word "but."

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m having that same problem right now.

speaker: STONECYPHER
line: Have you ever been to a team seminar, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, you know unfortunately around this time of year I always develop a severe hemorrhoidal condition.

speaker: KINSLEY
line: Well, it builds muscles you didn’t even know you had.

speaker: STONECYPHER
line: Communication. That’s the key.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Sorry, folks, it’ll be a few minutes.

speaker: KINSLEY
line: What’s going on, officer?

speaker: OFFICER
line: Got a little situation is all.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you, Jesus.

speaker: KINSLEY
line: Where’s he going?

speaker: MOTHER (ASEKOFF)
line: Oh, excuse me. Are you from search and rescue?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I’m sorry, I’m not. I’m just stretching my legs.

speaker: MOTHER
line: They said they’d have word for us about what happened to my husband. I need somebody to tell me what’s going on.

speaker: MULDER
line: Just slow down. I - I don’t know what you’re talking about.

speaker: MOTHER
line: My husband, Michael, he was teaching our son to shoot, and he said the dog got spooked and then he heard gunshots and now he’s said they’ve found a jacket with blood on it, but they won’t tell me anything about my husband...

speaker: MULDER
line: I’ll try to find out who’s in charge, all right?

speaker: MOTHER
line: Oh, thank you.

speaker: STONECYPHER
line: Now where’s he going?

speaker: KINSLEY
line: Hey, Stonecypher! Take a look at this. This tree was here twenty years before Ponce De Leon landed.

speaker: STONECYPHER
line: We’re going to be late for the wine and cheese reception.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Officer Fazekas?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Yes? Can I help you?

speaker: MULDER
line: My name is Fox Mulder. I’m an agent with the FBI.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: FBI? Who called you guys out?

speaker: MULDER
line: Nobody. We just got stopped at your roadblock. It sounds like you had a shooting.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Shots were reported, but we have no evidence of anyone being shot.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, what do you have evidence of?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: A survey team working these woods didn’t report in last night We found one man’s bloody jacket pretty torn up. And this morning, a boy got separated from his father.

speaker: MULDER
line: Separated by what?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: It looks, maybe, like some kind of animal attack.

speaker: MULDER
line: What kind of animal?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: I’m not sure yet. I followed good tracks for the two surveyors but the trails became confused as they moved into the brush. There was a third set of tracks leading away. I.... I couldn’t identify.

speaker: MULDER
line: Couldn’t identify as the surveyors’?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: As man or animal.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, just, uh... Hold on a second.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about the boy’s father?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: I tracked him all the way down to where he fired the shots. The ground’s rocky, but from the depressions in the underlying soil, I can tell you that he entered the bushes from over there where I pick up another set of tracks – two distinctly different sets of tracks that from the way the ground’s upset that is probably where the man was attacked.

speaker: MULDER
line: But no other sign of him? Do you have panther in these woods?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: There’s panther. Bear

speaker: MULDER
line: But these tracks look like neither of those.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: No, sir.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know of a good motel in the area?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Excuse me. I think we can handle this very well on our own. Thanks.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? We’ve got this conference. They’re waiting.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. How do I say this without using any negative words, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You want me to tell them that you’re not going to make it to this year’s teamwork seminar.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, you see that? We don’t need that conference. We have communication like that, unspoken. You know what I’m thinking.

speaker: LOUIS
line: He’s not coming back, is he?

speaker: MOTHER
line: Why would you say that?

speaker: LOUIS
line: Dad’s a good shot. If he hit what he was aiming at he’d be home by now.

speaker: MOTHER
line: You got to be brave, Louis. We both got to be brave. We’ll find out more about it in the morning. Get some sleep now.

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s open. Who cut the cheese?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Since you won’t be making it to the conference....

speaker: MULDER
line: Partaaayyy!

speaker: SCULLY
line: However, I must remind you this goes against the Bureau’s policy of male and female agents consorting in the same motel room while on assignment.

speaker: MULDER
line: Try any of that Tailhook crap on me, Scully, I’ll kick your ass. Pop quiz. What animal will attack the strongest leaving the weakest to escape? The answer is none. Not one of the over 4,000 species native to North America will attack the strongest when the weak is vulnerable.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, what does that have to do with anything?

speaker: MULDER
line: It makes me think that what we’re dealing with here is no ordinary predator.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I thought this was just a ploy to get out of the conference.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think what we stumbled upon here is something more that what local authorities realize. The scenario described by that boy sound to me like a primitive culling technique.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, we’re in Western Florida. The closest thing to primitive down here is living in a beachfront retirement condo.

speaker: MULDER
line: Those woods are as old as anything in the south and there’s 800 square miles of them. There’s no telling what’s alive out there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are you going?

speaker: MULDER
line: I got to check something out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know, Mulder, sometimes I think some work on your communication skills wouldn’t be such a bad idea.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’ll be back soon, and we can build a tower of furniture. ‘Kay?

speaker: MOTHER
line: What is it, Bo?

speaker: LOUIS
line: Mom?

speaker: MOTHER
line: It’s all right, Louis. You go back to sleep now. Bo? Bo? Bo, where’d you get to? Bo is that you? Come on boy. Let’s go back in. All right, all right. You... stay there tonight.

speaker: MOTHER
line: Louis? Louis? Louis?! Louis?!!! Louis!!!!

speaker: LOUIS
line: Mom?

speaker: LOUIS
line: Ahhhhhh!!!

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it, Louis?

speaker: LOUIS
line: It’s in the house.

speaker: MULDER
line: Be right back.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How’s the boy?

speaker: MULDER
line: He’s still freaked out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think I might have some insight into this invisible creature he said was chasing him.

speaker: MULDER
line: The Invisible Man was invisible.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Right.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, he said he was chased by a creature with glowing red eyes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: nan

speaker: MULDER
line: Let me show you something. Mrs. Asekoff said she went outside with the dog?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mm hmm.

speaker: MULDER
line: But when she came back, the door was locked from the inside.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And?

speaker: MULDER
line: Look at this. We got some tracks here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where?

speaker: MULDER
line: Here, and here.... dried mud against the tile, tracked in from the outside.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That could have been brought in by the dog.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no. You see, uh, the ball of the foot here? A large foot and I count five toes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wait a minute. I thought you said it wasn’t human.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I’m not saying it is. The weight distribution is all wrong. People walk heel to toe. Whatever this thing is it walks on the ball of its foot.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You’re putting me on.

speaker: MULDER
line: No. My dad and I were Indian Guides. I know these things.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, if it’s not man and it’s not animal, what the hell is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: nan

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Guess I’m a little late to this dance.

speaker: MULDER
line: I found some tracks – right here.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Same as I saw before.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where was that?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: In the woods. Weight distribution’s strange. They appear to be human, but whoever left these uses the balls of his feet more like an animal.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, whatever it is, it’s attacked three grown men, presumably in broad daylight disposing of its prey without detection. And it wasn’t shy last night about coming out of the woods to try again. What we’ve got here is a predator with low visibility and a high degree of motivation. And it’s got one advantage we don’t have – the entire Apilachacola National Forest.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Then how do you stop it?

speaker: MULDER
line: By identifying it. Finding it before it finds somebody else.

speaker: JEFF
line: It’s called FLIR for Forward Looking InfraRed. It was developed for chopper pilots in Vietnam. Detects body heat at 300 yards.

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s pretty sophisticated for government issue.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: I see you two have met. Jeff’s our local Tech Head. Some people prefer searching with dogs, I prefer an extra pair of hands if I get in trouble. Are we ready to go, here? Once we start in, you can put away your cel phones. The only communication in these woods is with short-wave radios. So stay close, maintain visual contact. If you get lost, initiate oral contact. That means holler. If nobody responds, sit down – don’t move. I will find you. Don’t go looking for me. I know it sounds obvious, but folks still get lost.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay. I get you. Thank you. All right. Local PD has all their resources looking out for a transient, a drifter who’s wanted for a double homicide in Gasden, Alabama. They were amused when I told them what we were doing.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t think it’s a drifter, Scully, and we may be looking for two individuals.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why do you say that?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that thing lured that woman out of the house last night to separate her from her son.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But for what purpose?

speaker: MULDER
line: Divide and conquer. If your enemy has greater numbers than you, you divide and conquer it to diminish those numbers.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What enemy would that be?

speaker: MULDER
line: Encroaching development. That’s what I suspected when I went to check on Louis and his mother.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think this is about a housing tract?

speaker: MULDER
line: That survey team was staking out a new 100,000 acre plot. Civilization is pushing very hard into these woods. Maybe something in these woods is pushing back.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Anything?

speaker: JEFF
line: No. No, nothing at all. Not even wildlife.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Isn’t that a little strange?

speaker: JEFF
line: Yeah. This forest is usually alive with sound. I’m not like an expert, but I’ve never seen it like this before.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it sure is beautiful, though.

speaker: JEFF
line: Well, that’s what happens. People get to looking around, next thing they know, something eats ‘em.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you think killed those men?

speaker: JEFF
line: Nature is populated by creatures either trying to kill something they need to survive, or trying to avoid being killed by something that needs them to survive. If we become blinded by the beauty of nature, we may fail to see its cruelty and violence.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Walt Whitman?

speaker: JEFF
line: No. When Animals Attack on the Fox Network.

speaker: JEFF
line: Wait, I’ve got something. It’s about twenty yards ahead.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Where? I don’t see it.

speaker: JEFF
line: It’s just sitting there. It’s on the move! It’s moving fast! It’s... it’s going to the right! Wait, wait. There’s two of them now. They’re moving in opposite directions. There and there.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is it?

speaker: JEFF
line: It’s about 40 yards ahead of you!

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t see it.

speaker: JEFF
line: Now it’s .. gone. I don’t know where it went.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: I don’t know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They’re trying to separate us – pull us away from the others. Let’s go back.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Ahhhhh!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Michelle? Michelle?! Jeez. Mulder, I need help! Mulder!

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully!!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Over here!

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Over here!

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don’t know.

speaker: JEFF
line: Where’s Fazekas?

speaker: SCULLY
line: She was walking right ahead of me. She was right here, and then she was just gone.

speaker: JEFF
line: I’m getting no reading.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What the hell’s happening here?

speaker: MULDER
line: They separated us. That was on purpose. They divided us so they could go after her. She was in the lead and presumably the strongest. They take the strongest first.

speaker: JEFF
line: They take them where? That doesn’t make any sense. You can’t just disappear out here.

speaker: MULDER
line: You’re right. We got to find her.

speaker: JEFF
line: How we gonna do that?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t know! We’ll form a line and beat the bushes. Maybe you’ll pick up a signal.

speaker: JEFF
line: No, we need help. We need man power. That’s not going to work out here! We need to get out of here. Listen to me!

speaker: MULDER
line: The longer we wait, the less chance we have of finding her.

speaker: JEFF
line: This is nuts. This is loony tune, man. We got to go back out of the woods before it gets dark.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay. You’re right. You go back. You leave me the FLIR and you go back.

speaker: JEFF
line: We got to go together.

speaker: MULDER
line: We have to find her.

speaker: JEFF
line: Yeah, but if we stay here, they may not find any of us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, he’s right. We weren’t prepared for this. We have no way of telling them where we are. We don’t have any food. Michelle had our only water. Look, I’d like to find her, too, but I think the risks of that are just way too foolish.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right. We all go then. You lead the way.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don’t have much faith that this device will do us any good.

speaker: MULDER
line: So far all it’s done is split us up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Whatever it is that we were chasing did show up on the screen at first.

speaker: MULDER
line: What does that tell you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nothing.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mm hmm.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Except that we’re going in the right direction.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe it can regulate its temperature. Do you know of any animal that can?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ticks. I’ve heard that they can halt their metabolism for up to 18 years, essentially going into suspended animation until something warm-blooded comes along.

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s interesting.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why is that interesting?

speaker: MULDER
line: 30 years ago, the, uh, the town of Point Pleasant, West Virginia was terrorized for over a year by something – killing livestock and terrorizing the people. Witnesses described them as primitive looking men with red piercing eyes. Became known as the "moth men." I’ve got an X-File dating back to 1952 on it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What would that be filed next to - - "The Cockroach That Ate Cincinnati?"

speaker: MULDER
line: No, "The Cockroach That Ate Cincinnati" is in the C’s. "Moth Men’s" over in the M’s.

speaker: JEFF
line: This isn’t the way.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: JEFF
line: Michelle always marks her route with little white stones.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is the same path. This is the way we came.

speaker: JEFF
line: I haven’t seen one of her stones for twenty minutes.

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s because you’ve had your nose glued to that screen the whole time.

speaker: JEFF
line: I’m telling you – we’re on the wrong trail! Somehow, we got off track. Oh man, this is not happening. This is not happening.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Everybody stand still. There’s something out there.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where?

speaker: SCULLY
line: About 40 or 50 yards out.

speaker: MULDER
line: Jeff?

speaker: JEFF
line: Nothing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I saw it. The woods have gone silent again.

speaker: JEFF
line: I got it!

speaker: MULDER
line: Where?

speaker: JEFF
line: I got it on my screen!

speaker: MULDER
line: Where?

speaker: JEFF
line: About 30 yards ahead. It’s just sitting there. What is he doing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Talk to him.

speaker: JEFF
line: This is not a good idea!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Talk to him, Jeff!

speaker: JEFF
line: Uh, go to your right. It just disappeared.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it’s not on the screen.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, I lost it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I got it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you hit it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don’t know. It just stopped.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where’s Glaser?

speaker: MULDER
line: How many shots did you fire?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Six, maybe seven.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that your only clip?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yep.

speaker: MULDER
line: Don’t fire again unless you’re sure you’re gonna hit it. It may be trying to spend our advantage.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What the hell is it, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t know. But what ever it is, it’s smarter than us – at least out here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? Mulder!!

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully! Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!!

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: You okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You were an Indian Guide. Help me out here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Indian Guide says maybe you should run to the store and get some matches.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I would, but I left my wallet in the car.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you doing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Trying to open my gun. If I can separate the shell from the casing maybe I can get the powder to ignite.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh. And maybe it’ll start raining weenies and marshmallows.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do I detect a hint of negativity?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. Yes... actually. Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you need to keep warm. Your body’s still in shock.

speaker: MULDER
line: I was told once that the best way to regenerate body heat was to crawl naked into a sleeping bag with some body else who’s already naked.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, maybe if it rains sleeping bags, you’ll get lucky.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Have you thought seriously about dying?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, once, when I was at the Ice Capades.

speaker: SCULLY
line: When I was fighting my cancer, I was angry at the injustice of it and its meaninglessness. And then I realized that that was the struggle – to give it meaning. To make sense of it. It’s like life.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think Nature is supremely indifferent to whether we live or die. I mean, if you’re lucky you get 75 years. If you’re really lucky you get 80 years. And if you’re extraordinarily lucky, you get to have 50 of those years with a decent head of hair.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I guess it’s like Las Vegas. The house always wins. Oh! Ta-da.

speaker: MULDER
line: Go, girl.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, who did you identify with when you were a kid? Wilma or Betty?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I identified with Betty’s bustline.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes! I did, too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Could never have been married to Barney, though. The kids were cute.

speaker: MULDER
line: But where are they today?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Moth Men? Really?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. But there seem to be only two of them.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t wanna wrestle.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Get over here. I’m going to try and keep you warm. Sorry.

speaker: MULDER
line: One of us has got to stay awake, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You sleep, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: If you get tired, you wake me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m not going to get tired.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why don’t you sing .. something.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No... Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, if you sing something, I’ll know you’re awake.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you don’t want me to sing. I can’t carry a tune.

speaker: MULDER
line: It doesn’t matter. Just sing anything.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jeremiah was a bull frog ---

speaker: SCULLY
line: ... was a good friend of mine. Never understood a single word he said...

speaker: SCULLY
line: ... but I helped him drink his wine.

speaker: MULDER
line: Chorus.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Joy.... to the world. All the boys and girls. Joy to the fishes in the deep blue sea. Joy to you and me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully?!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mmmm....over here.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you doing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m looking for food. I found some wild berries.

speaker: MULDER
line: I wouldn’t go far.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you never left my sight.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully? Scully? Scully! Scully!?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m down here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I fell down a hole.

speaker: MULDER
line: You all right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I landed on soft dirt .. kind of.

speaker: MULDER
line: What’s down there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don’t know. It’s pretty dark. Oh!

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, what’s going on? Are you okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I found Michelle.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is she alive?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not for much longer. Mulder, we have to get her out of here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is there a way out?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don’t know. I .. I’m in some kind of a chamber. There’s .. there’s like some kind of network. Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m not alone. I don’t have my weapon. Mulder!?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hold on, I’m going to drop my gun down.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jeez!! Mulder, are you okay?

speaker: MULDER
line: Don’t mind me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, look. There has to be a scientific explanation for this.

speaker: MULDER
line: Too bad we don’t have any office furniture.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If they could see us now.

speaker: MULDER
line: Go, team. 20 more bodies and we’ll win the Honey-Baked Ham.

speaker: MULDER
line: We’re down here!

speaker: SCULLY
line: We’re down here!

speaker: KINSLEY
line: What’re you doing down there?

speaker: MULDER
line: We’ve got injured people down here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We need a ladder.

speaker: KINSLEY
line: Right away.

speaker: STONECYPHER
line: Hey, over here!

speaker: MOTHER
line: He’s going to be okay. He’s going to be fine. Just a minute.

speaker: KINSLEY
line: Well, we just got all the thanks when you did all the work.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, on the contrary, Agent Kinsley, we would never have gotten involved in this if not for you.

speaker: KINSLEY
line: Really?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, you see this?

speaker: KINSLEY
line: Oh, yeah. I pointed that out to Agent Stonecypher on the drive down.

speaker: MULDER
line: There was something in the cave that Scully fell into ; an inscription - Ad Noctum.

speaker: KINSLEY
line: That’s, uh –

speaker: MULDER
line: It means "into darkness". The Spanish Conquistadors used to carve it on the posts that they would lash the natives to as a warning.

speaker: KINSLEY
line: So who’re you saying wrote this?

speaker: MULDER
line: Ponce De Leon came here 450 years ago looking for the Fountain Of Youth.

speaker: KINSLEY
line: You mean you think that these... that - that - that- that body the one that Agent Scully shot? No -

speaker: MULDER
line: After 400 years in the woods don’t you think they might have adapted perfectly to their environment?

speaker: KINSLEY
line: You’re just making this up.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why do you say that?

speaker: KINSLEY
line: ‘Cause, you work on the X-Files, and you just want to write off your motel.

speaker: STONECYPHER
line: Search and Rescue are still unable to find Jeff Glaser or the second predator that you reported.

speaker: MULDER
line: I wouldn’t be surprised if they couldn’t find either one of them.

speaker: STONECYPHER
line: Agent Mulder, I’m confused. Why would they come after the boy in the house that night?

speaker: MULDER
line: These predators have been in these woods for a long, long time. They would have perceived any encroachment on their territory as an enemy, even a little kid like that.

speaker: STONECYPHER
line: But that would mean that they’d come after any one of us that had gone into the woods, wouldn’t it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Where’s Agent Scully?

speaker: STONECYPHER
line: Oh, she got a lift back to the motel to pack up both your things.

speaker: MULDER
line: She did? Excuse me.

speaker: KINSLEY
line: My jacket’s in that car.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully!? Scully!!!??

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what’s going on?

speaker: MULDER
line: Let’s get out of here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: ‘Kay.

speaker: MULDER
line: You pack everything?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.
